drupalNodeEvent.title: 14th All India Conference of China Studies | Thematic Panel IV: History and Cultural Linkages

field_speakers.processed: Prof. Kamal Sheel (Retired Banaras Hindu University), Divya Pokhriyal (University of Delhi), Diki Sherpa (Chinese University of Hong Kong), Tiasangla Longkumer (Jawaharlal Nehru University), Jana Chaudhuri (Institute of Heritage Research Delhi), Premmi Wahengbam (Gauhati University), Dr. Madhavi Thampi (Institute of Chinese Studies)

field_organizers.processed: Institute of Chinese Studies Delhi, Visva-Bharati University Santiniketan, Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung

field_description.processed: In “Evolution on Queenship as an Institution in Imperial China”, Divya Pokhriyal studies the institution of Queenship in China & the relationship between gender & power in Chinese history. In “Native Administration in Early Colonial Hong Kong: Appointing Native Chinese Peace Officers”, Diki Sherpa assesses the aim and rationale for the same. In “Scientific Medicine in Colonial India and Imperial China: A Study of Rockefeller Foundation Philanthropy in Medical Education”, Tiasangla Longkumer traces the Rockefeller Foundation’s development of medical education in China and India, its impact, & implications on modern scientific medical education. In “Historic Urban Landscape Approach: Application in China”, Jana Chaudhuri analyses adaptation of Historic Urban Landscape in Pilot cities of China and assesses the rationale behind their selection. In “Peking Opera and Shumang Leela: Bridging the Arts”, Premmi Wahengbham examines cultural linkages and influences between China & Manipur(India)
